00003 /***
00004 File: ADF_internals.c
00005   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00006                         BOEING
00007   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00008         Project: CGNS
00009         Author: Tom Dickens   234-1024    tpd6908@yak.ca.boeing.com
00010         Date: 3/2/1995
00011         Purpose: Provide the underlying support for the ADF-Core.
00012   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00013   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00014 Notes:  Integer numbers are stored on disk as ASCII-hex numbers.
00015         2 bytes gives a number from 0 to 255,
00016         4 bytes 0 to 65,535,
00017         8 bytes 0 to 4,294,967,295,
00018         and 12 bytes from 0 to 281,474,976,710,655.
00019 
00020 Pointers are 12 bytes.
00021         8 bytes pointing to a 4096-byte chunk on disk,
00022         and 4 bytes is an offset into that chunk.
00023 This gives a maximum file size of 17,592,186,048,512 bytes (17.5 Tera bytes).
00024 
00025   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00026         The tables below detail the format of the information which
00027         makes up the ADF file.
00028 
00029         There are 7 different, unique types of data "chunks" used.
00030         Three of these are of fixed length, and the other four are
00031         variable in length.
00032 
00033         With the exception of numeric data (user's data), all information
00034         in an ADF file is written in ASCII.
00035 
00036         Uniquely-defined boundary-tags are used to surround all "chunks"
00037         of information.  These tags are checked to confirm "chunk" type
00038         and also to ensure data integrity.
00039   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00040       186   Physical disk-First block
00041 bytes   start   end   description      range / format
00042  32    0   31   "what" description      "@(#)ADF Database Version AXXxxx>"
00043   4   32   35   "AdF0" boundary tag      Tag
00044  28   36   63   Creation date/time       "Wed Apr 19 09:33:25 1995    "
00045   4   64   67   "AdF1" boundary tag      Tag
00046  28   68   95   Modification date/time   "Wed Apr 19 09:33:29 1995   "
00047   4   96   99   "AdF2" boundary tag      Tag
00048   1  100  100   Numeric format           ['B', 'L', 'C', 'N']
00049   1  101  101   Duplicate of numeric format      ['B', 'L', 'C', 'N']
00050   4  102  105   "AdF3" boundary tag      Tag
00051   2  106  107   sizeof( char )           0 to 255
00052   2  108  109   sizeof( short )          0 to 255
00053   2  110  111   sizeof( int )            0 to 255
00054   2  112  113   sizeof( long )           0 to 255
00055   2  114  115   sizeof( float )          0 to 255
00056   2  116  117   sizeof( double )         0 to 255
00057   2  118  119   sizeof( char * )         0 to 255
00058   2  120  121   sizeof( short * )        0 to 255
00059   2  122  123   sizeof( int  *)          0 to 255
00060   2  124  125   sizeof( long * )         0 to 255
00061   2  126  127   sizeof( float  *)        0 to 255
00062   2  128  129   sizeof( double  *)       0 to 255
00063   4  130  133   "AdF4" boundary tag      Tag
00064  12  134  145   Root-node header pointer Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00065  12  146  157   End-of-File pointer      Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00066  12  158  169   Free-Chunk table pointer Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00067  12  170  181   Extra pointer            Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00068   4  182  185   "AdF5" boundary tag      Tag
00069 
00070 
00071        80   Free-Chunk table
00072 bytes   start   end   description      range / format
00073   4    0    3   "fCbt" boundary tag      Tag
00074  12    4   15   First small block pointer  Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00075  12   16   27   Last small block pointer   Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00076  12   28   39   First medium block pointer Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00077  12   40   51   Last medium block pointer  Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00078  12   52   63   First large block pointer  Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00079  12   64   75   Last large block pointer   Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00080   4   76   79   "fcte" boundarg tag      Tag
00081 
00082 
00083    Variable: min   32   Free Chunk
00084 bytes   start   end   description      range / format
00085   4    0    3   "FreE" boundary tag      Tag
00086  12    4   15   Pointer to End-of-Chunk-Tag
00087  12   16   27   Pointer to Next-Chunk in list
00088   0   28    -   more free space
00089   4   28   31   "EndC" boundarg tag      Tag
00090 
00091 Note:  There can occur other free space "gas" in the file which are smaller
00092        than the 32-bytes needed to have tags and pointers.  The convention
00093        in these cases is to just fill the entire free space with the letter
00094        z, lower-case.
00095 
00096       246   Node header
00097 bytes   start   end   description      range / format
00098   4    0    3   "NoDe" boundary tag      Tag
00099  32    4   35   Name                     Text:  Blank filled
00100  32   36   67   Label                    Text:  Blank filled
00101   8   68   75   Number of sub-nodes      0 to 4,294,967,295
00102   8   76   83   Entries for sub-nodes    0 to 4,294,967,295
00103  12   84   95   Pointer to sub-node table      Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00104  32   96  127   Data-type                Text:  Blank filled
00105   2  128  129   Number of dimensions      0 to 12
00106   8  130  137   Dimension value 0         0 to 4,294,967,295
00107   8  138  145   Dimension value 1         0 to 4,294,967,295
00108   8  146  153   Dimension value 2         0 to 4,294,967,295
00109   8  154  161   Dimension value 3         0 to 4,294,967,295
00110   8  162  169   Dimension value 4         0 to 4,294,967,295
00111   8  170  177   Dimension value 5         0 to 4,294,967,295
00112   8  178  185   Dimension value 6         0 to 4,294,967,295
00113   8  186  193   Dimension value 7         0 to 4,294,967,295
00114   8  194  201   Dimension value 8         0 to 4,294,967,295
00115   8  202  209   Dimension value 9         0 to 4,294,967,295
00116   8  210  217   Dimension value 10        0 to 4,294,967,295
00117   8  218  225   Dimension value 11        0 to 4,294,967,295
00118   4  226  229   Number of data chunks     0 to 65,535
00119  12  230  241   Pointer to data chunk (or table)      Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00120   4  242  245   "TaiL" boundary tag      Tag
00121 
00122 
00123    Variable: min   64   Sub-node table
00124 bytes   start   end   description      range / format
00125   4    0    3   "SNTb" boundary tag      Tag
00126  12    4   15   Pointer to End-of-Table-Tag
00127  32   16   47   Child's name             Text:  Blank filled
00128  12   48   59   Pointer to child         Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00129  32    -    -   Child's name             Text:  Blank filled
00130  12    -    -   Pointer to child         Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00131  32    -    -   Child's name             Text:  Blank filled
00132  12    -    -   Pointer to child         Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00133  32    -    -   Child's name             Text:  Blank filled
00134  12    -    -   Pointer to child         Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00135  32    -    -   Child's name             Text:  Blank filled
00136  12    -    -   Pointer to child         Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00137  32    -    -   Child's name             Text:  Blank filled
00138  12    -    -   Pointer to child         Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00139   4   60   63   "snTE" boundary tag      Tag
00140 
00141 
00142    Variable: min   44   Data-chunk table
00143 bytes   start   end   description      range / format
00144   4    0    3   "DCtb" boundary tag      Tag
00145  12    4   15   Pointer to End-of-Table-Tag
00146  12   16   27   Pointer to data start    Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00147  12   28   39   Pointer to data end      Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00148  12    -    -   Pointer to data start    Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00149  12    -    -   Pointer to data end      Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00150  12    -    -   Pointer to data start    Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00151  12    -    -   Pointer to data end      Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00152  12    -    -   Pointer to data start    Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00153  12    -    -   Pointer to data end      Disk chunk, chunk offset.
00154   4   40   43   "dcTE" boundarg tag      Tag
00155

00310 /***********************************************************************
00311         Priority Stack Buffer is used to buffer some of the overhead of
00312         reading small blocks of file control information like the node
00313         header by saving the data into a memory buffer. The buffer has
00314         a priority value associated with it and is used to determine
00315         which entry to replace when the stack is full!! Each stack entry
00316         could be as large as 274 bytes since the stack data could be for
00317         a node where NODE_HEADER_SIZE = 246.
00318 ***********************************************************************/
00319 #define MAX_STACK 50
00320 static struct {
00321   int file_index;
00322   unsigned int file_block;
00323   unsigned int block_offset;
00324   int stack_type;
00325   char *stack_data;
00326   int priority_level;
00327 } PRISTK[MAX_STACK] ;
00328 /* Define stack types */
00329 enum { FILE_STK=1, NODE_STK, DISK_PTR_STK, FREE_CHUNK_STK, SUBNODE_STK };
00330 /* Define stack control modes */
00331 enum { INIT_STK, CLEAR_STK, CLEAR_STK_TYPE, DEL_STK_ENTRY, GET_STK, SET_STK };
00332 /***********************************************************************
00333         Defined macros
00334 ***********************************************************************/
00335 #define EVAL_2_BYTES( C0, C1 )  (((C0)<<8)+((C1)))
00336 #define EVAL_4_BYTES( C0, C1, C2, C3 ) (((C0)<<24)+((C1)<<16)+((C2)<<8)+((C3)))

00338 /* file ADFI_ASCII_Hex_2_unsigned_int.c */
00339 /***********************************************************************
00340 ADFI ASCII Hex to unsigned int:
00341         Convert a number of ASCII-HEX into an unsigned integer.
00342 
00343 input:  const unsigned int minimum      Expected minimum number.
00344 input:  const unsigned int maximum      Expected maximum number.
00345 input:  const unsigned int string_length Length (bytes) of the input string.
00346 input:  const char string[]             The input string.
00347 output: unsigned int *number            The resulting number.
00348 output: int *error_return               Error return.
00349 
00350    Possible errors:
00351 NO_ERROR
00352 NULL_POINTER
00353 NULL_STRING_POINTER
00354 STRING_LENGTH_ZERO
00355 STRING_LENGTH_TOO_BIG
00356 STRING_NOT_A_HEX_STRING
00357 NUMBER_LESS_THAN_MINIMUM
00358 NUMBER_GREATER_THAN_MAXIMUM
00359 ***********************************************************************/
00360 void    ADFI_ASCII_Hex_2_unsigned_int(
00361                 const unsigned int minimum,
00362                 const unsigned int maximum,
00363                 const unsigned int string_length,
00364                 const char string[],
00365                 unsigned int *number,
00366                 int *error_return )
00367 {
00368 unsigned int    i,      
00369                 ir,     
00370                 j,      
00371                 num ;   
00373 if( string == NULL ) {
00374    *error_return = NULL_STRING_POINTER ;
00375    return ;
00376    } /* end if */
00377 
00378 if( string_length == 0 ) {
00379    *error_return = STRING_LENGTH_ZERO ;
00380    return ;
00381    } /* end if */
00382 
00383 if( number == NULL ) {
00384    *error_return = NULL_POINTER ;
00385    return ;
00386    } /* end if */
00387 
00388 if( string_length > 8 ) {
00389    *error_return = STRING_LENGTH_TOO_BIG ;
00390    return ;
00391    } /* end if */
00392 
00393 if( minimum > maximum ) {
00394    *error_return = MINIMUM_GT_MAXIMUM ;
00395    return ;
00396    } /* end if */
00397 
00398 *error_return = NO_ERROR ;
00399 
00401 num = 0 ;
00402 ir = (string_length - 1) << 2;
00403 for( i=0; i<string_length; i++) {
00404    if (string[i] >= '0' && string[i] <= '9')
00405       j = string[i] - 48;
00406    else if (string[i] >= 'A' && string[i] <= 'F')
00407       j = string[i] - 55;
00408    else if (string[i] >= 'a' && string[i] <= 'f')
00409       j = string[i] - 87;
00410    else {
00411       *error_return = STRING_NOT_A_HEX_STRING ;
00412       return ;
00413    }
00414    num += (j << ir);
00415    ir -= 4;
00416 }
00417 
00418 if( num < minimum ) {
00419    *error_return = NUMBER_LESS_THAN_MINIMUM ;
00420    return ;
00421    } /* end if */
00422 
00423 if( num > maximum ) {
00424    *error_return = NUMBER_GREATER_THAN_MAXIMUM ;
00425    return ;
00426    } /* end if */
00427 
00429 *number = num ;
00430 } /* end of ADFI_ASCII_Hex_2_unsigned_int */
00431 /* end of file ADFI_ASCII_Hex_2_unsigned_int.c */
00432 /* file ADFI_Abort.c */

00434 ADFI Abort:
00435         Do any cleanup and then shut the application down.
00436 
00437 input:  const int error_code    Error which caused the Abort.
00438 output: -none-                  Hey, we ain't coming back...
00439 ***********************************************************************/
00440 void    ADFI_Abort(
00441                 const int error_code )

00447 /* file ADFI_ID_2_file_block_offset.c */
00448 /***********************************************************************
00449 ADFI ID to file block and offset:
00450 
00451         The ID is a combination of the file-index, the block within the
00452         file, and an offset within the block.
00453 
00454    the file index is an unsigned 16-bit int.
00455    block pointer is a 32-bit unsigned int.
00456    block offset is a 16-bit unsigned int.
00457 
00458 input:  const double ID                 Given ADF ID.
00459 output: unsigned int *file_index        File index from the ID.
00460 output: unsigned long *file_block       File block from the ID.
00461 output: unsigned long *block_offset     Block offset from the ID.
00462 output: int *error_return               Error return.
00463 
00464    Possible errors:
00465 NO_ERROR
00466 NULL_POINTER
00467 FILE_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE
00468 BLOCK_OFFSET_OUT_OF_RANGE
00469 ***********************************************************************/
00470 void    ADFI_ID_2_file_block_offset(
00471                 const double ID,
00472                 unsigned int *file_index,
00473                 unsigned long *file_block,
00474                 unsigned long *block_offset,
00475                 int *error_return )
00476 {
00477 unsigned char * cc;
00478 
00479 if( (file_index == NULL) || (file_block == NULL) || (block_offset == NULL) ) {
00480    *error_return = NULL_POINTER ;
00481    return ;
00482    } /* end if */
00483 
00484 if( ID == 0.0 ) {
00485    *error_return = NODE_ID_ZERO ;
00486    return ;
00487    } /* end if */
00488 
00489 *error_return = NO_ERROR ;
00490 cc = (unsigned char *) &ID;
00491 #ifdef PRINT_STUFF
00492 printf("In ADFI_ID_2_file_block_offset: ID=%lf\n",ID);
00493 printf("cc[0-7] = %02X %02X %02X %02X %02X %02X %02X %02X \n",
00494         cc[0], cc[1], cc[2], cc[3],
00495         cc[4], cc[5], cc[6], cc[7] ) ;
00496 #endif
00497 
00498 if ( ADF_this_machine_format == IEEE_BIG_FORMAT_CHAR ) {
00499    *file_index = cc[1] + ((cc[0] & 0x003f) << 8) ;
00500    *file_block = cc[2] + (cc[3]<<8) +
00501                  (cc[4]<<16) + (cc[5]<<24) ;
00502    *block_offset = cc[6] + (cc[7]<<8) ;
00503    } /* end if */
00504 else if ( ADF_this_machine_format == IEEE_LITTLE_FORMAT_CHAR ) {
00505    *file_index = cc[6] + ((cc[7] & 0x003f) << 8) ;
00506    *file_block = cc[2] + (cc[3]<<8) +
00507                  (cc[4]<<16) + (cc[5]<<24) ;
00508    *block_offset = cc[0] + (cc[1]<<8) ;
00509    } /* end else if */
00510 else {
00511    *file_index = cc[0] + (cc[1]<<8) ;
00512    *file_block = cc[2] + (cc[3]<<8) +
00513                  (cc[4]<<16) + (cc[5]<<24) ;
00514    *block_offset = cc[6] + (cc[7]<<8) ;
00515    } /* end else */
00516 
00517 #ifdef PRINT_STUFF
00518    printf("*file_index=%d, *file_block=%d, *block_offset=%d\n",
00519            *file_index, *file_block, *block_offset);
00520 #endif
00521 
00522 if( *file_index >= maximum_files ) {
00523    *error_return = FILE_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE ;
00524    return ;
00525    } /* end if */
00526 
00527 if( *block_offset >= DISK_BLOCK_SIZE ) {
00528    *error_return = BLOCK_OFFSET_OUT_OF_RANGE ;
00529    return ;
00530    } /* end if */
00531 } /* end of ADFI_ID_2_file_block_offset */
00532 /* end of file ADFI_ID_2_file_block_offset.c */
00533 /* file ADFI_add_2_sub_node_table.c */
00534 /***********************************************************************
00535 ADFI add 2 sub node table:
00536         Add a child to a parent's sub-node table.
00537 
00538 input:  const int file_index            Index of ADF file.
00539 input:  const struct DISK_POINTER *parent Location of the parent
00540 input:  const struct DISK_POINTER *child Location of the child.
00541 output: int *error_return               Error return.
00542 
00543    Possible errors:
00544 NO_ERROR
00545 NULL_POINTER
00546 ADF_FILE_NOT_OPENED
00547 SUB_NODE_TABLE_ENTRIES_BAD
00548 MEMORY_ALLOCATION_FAILED
00549 ***********************************************************************/
00550 void    ADFI_add_2_sub_node_table(
00551                 const int file_index,
00552                 const struct DISK_POINTER *parent,
00553                 const struct DISK_POINTER *child,
00554                 int *error_return )
00555 {
00556 struct  NODE_HEADER     parent_node, child_node ;
00557 struct SUB_NODE_TABLE_ENTRY *sub_node_table ;
00558 struct DISK_POINTER tmp_disk_ptr ;
00559 unsigned int    old_num_entries ;
00560 int                     i ;
00561 
00562 if( (parent == NULL) || (child == NULL) ) {
00563    *error_return = NULL_POINTER ;
00564    return ;
00565    } /* end if */
00566 
00567 if( file_index >= maximum_files || ADF_file[file_index].in_use == 0 ) {
00568    *error_return = ADF_FILE_NOT_OPENED ;
00569    return ;
00570    } /* end if */
00571 
00572 *error_return = NO_ERROR ;
00573 
00575 ADFI_read_node_header( file_index, parent, &parent_node, error_return ) ;
00576 if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00577    return ;
00578 
00580 ADFI_read_node_header( file_index, child, &child_node, error_return ) ;
00581 if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00582    return ;
00583 
00585 if( parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes <= parent_node.num_sub_nodes ) {
00586    old_num_entries = parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes ;
00587 
00589    if( parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes == 0 )
00590       parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes = LIST_CHUNK ;
00591    else
00592       parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes = (unsigned int) (
00593        (float) parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes * LIST_CHUNK_GROW_FACTOR ) ;
00594 
00595    if( parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes <= parent_node.num_sub_nodes ) {
00596       *error_return = SUB_NODE_TABLE_ENTRIES_BAD ;
00597       return ;
00598       } /* end if */
00599 
00601    sub_node_table = (struct SUB_NODE_TABLE_ENTRY *)
00602                     malloc( parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes *
00603                     sizeof( *sub_node_table ) ) ;
00604    if( sub_node_table == NULL ) {
00605       *error_return = MEMORY_ALLOCATION_FAILED ;
00606       return ;
00607       } /* end if */
00608 
00610    if( old_num_entries > 0 ) {
00611       ADFI_read_sub_node_table( file_index, &parent_node.sub_node_table,
00612            sub_node_table, error_return ) ;
00613       if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00614          return ;
00615       } /* end if */
00616 
00618    for( i=parent_node.num_sub_nodes; i<(int) parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes;
00619                 i++ ) {
00620       strncpy( sub_node_table[i].child_name,
00621         /* "                                   ", ADF_NAME_LENGTH ) ; */
00622         "unused entry in sub-node-table     ", ADF_NAME_LENGTH ) ;
00623       sub_node_table[i].child_location.block = 0 ;
00624       sub_node_table[i].child_location.offset = DISK_BLOCK_SIZE ;
00625       } /* end for */
00626 
00628    if( parent_node.num_sub_nodes > 0 ) { /* delete old table from file */
00629       ADFI_delete_sub_node_table( file_index, &parent_node.sub_node_table,
00630                                   old_num_entries, error_return ) ;
00631       if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00632          return ;
00633       } /* end if */
00634 
00635   ADFI_file_malloc( file_index, TAG_SIZE + DISK_POINTER_SIZE + TAG_SIZE +
00636     parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes * (ADF_NAME_LENGTH + DISK_POINTER_SIZE),
00637     &tmp_disk_ptr, error_return ) ;
00638    if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00639       return ;
00640 
00641    parent_node.sub_node_table.block = tmp_disk_ptr.block ;
00642    parent_node.sub_node_table.offset = tmp_disk_ptr.offset ;
00643 
00645    ADFI_write_sub_node_table( file_index, &parent_node.sub_node_table,
00646         parent_node.entries_for_sub_nodes,
00647         (struct SUB_NODE_TABLE_ENTRY *)sub_node_table, error_return ) ;
00648    free( sub_node_table ) ;
00649    if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00650       return ;
00651    } /* end if */
00652 
00654 tmp_disk_ptr.block = parent_node.sub_node_table.block ;
00655 tmp_disk_ptr.offset = parent_node.sub_node_table.offset +
00656         TAG_SIZE + DISK_POINTER_SIZE +
00657         parent_node.num_sub_nodes * (ADF_NAME_LENGTH + DISK_POINTER_SIZE) ;
00658 
00659 ADFI_adjust_disk_pointer( &tmp_disk_ptr, error_return ) ;
00660 if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00661    return ;
00662 
00664 ADFI_write_file( file_index, tmp_disk_ptr.block, tmp_disk_ptr.offset,
00665                  ADF_NAME_LENGTH, child_node.name, error_return ) ;
00666 if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00667    return ;
00668 
00670 tmp_disk_ptr.offset += ADF_NAME_LENGTH ;
00671 ADFI_adjust_disk_pointer( &tmp_disk_ptr, error_return ) ;
00672 if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00673    return ;
00674 
00675 ADFI_write_disk_pointer_2_disk( file_index, tmp_disk_ptr.block,
00676                                 tmp_disk_ptr.offset, child, error_return ) ;
00677 if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00678    return ;
00679 
00681 parent_node.num_sub_nodes++ ;
00682 ADFI_write_node_header( file_index, parent, &parent_node, error_return ) ;
00683 if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
00684    return ;
00685 
00686 } /* end of ADFI_add_2_sub_node_table */
00687 /* end of file ADFI_add_2_sub_node_table.c */
00688 /* file ADFI_adjust_disk_pointer.c */
00689 /***********************************************************************
00690 ADFI adjust disk pointer:
00691         Adjust the disk pointer so that the offset is in a legal
00692         range; from 0 and < DISK_BLOCK_SIZE.
00693 
00694 input:  const struct DISK_POINTER *block_offset
00695 output: int *error_return               Error return.
00696 
00697    Possible errors:
00698 NO_ERROR
00699 NULL_POINTER
00700 BLOCK_OFFSET_OUT_OF_RANGE
00701 ***********************************************************************/
00702 void    ADFI_adjust_disk_pointer(
00703                 struct DISK_POINTER *block_offset,
00704                 int *error_return )
00705 {
00706 unsigned long oblock ;
00707 unsigned long nblock ;
00708 
00709 if( block_offset == NULL ) {
00710    *error_return = NULL_POINTER ;
00711    return ;
00712    } /* end if */
00713 
00714 *error_return = NO_ERROR ;
00715 
00716 if ( block_offset->offset < DISK_BLOCK_SIZE ) return ;
00717 
00719 nblock = (unsigned long) (block_offset->offset / DISK_BLOCK_SIZE) ;
00720 
00722 oblock = block_offset->block ;
00723 block_offset->block += nblock ;
00724 block_offset->offset -= nblock * DISK_BLOCK_SIZE ;
00725 if ( block_offset->block < oblock ) {
00726    *error_return = BLOCK_OFFSET_OUT_OF_RANGE ;
00727    return ;
00728    } /* end if */
00729 
00730 } /* end of ADFI_adjust_disk_pointer */
00731 /* end of file ADFI_adjust_disk_pointer.c */
00732 /* file ADFI_big_endian_32_swap_64.c */
00733 /***********************************************************************
00734 ADFI big endian 32 swap 64:
00735 
00736 input:  const char from_format          Format to convert from. 'B','L','C','N'
00737 input:  const char from_os_size         Format to convert from. 'B','L'
00738 input:  const char to_format            Format to convert to.
00739 input:  const char to_os_size           Format to convert to. 'B','L'
00740 input:  const char data_type[2]         The type of data to convert.
00741                                            MT I4 I8 U4 U8 R4 R8 X4 X8 C1 B1
00742 input:  const unsigned long delta_from_bytes Number of from_bytes used.
00743 input:  const unsigned long delta_to_bytes      Number of to_bytes used.
00744 input:  const char *from_data           The data to convert from.
00745 output: char *to_data                   The resulting data.
00746 output: int *error_return               Error return.
00747 
00748   Recognized data types:
00749                                         Machine representations
00750         Type              Notation     IEEE_BIG   IEEE_LITTLE   Cray
00751                                        32    64   32    64
00752   No data                   MT
00753   Integer 32                I4         I4    I4    I4   I4       I8
00754   Integer 64                I8         --    I8    --   I8       I8
00755   Unsigned 32               U4         I4    I4    I4   I4       I8
00756   Unsigned 64               U8         --    I8    --   I8       I8
00757   Real 32                   R4         R4    R4    R4   R4       R8
00758   Real 64                   R8         R8    R8    R8   R8       R8
00759   Complex 64                X4         R4R4  R4R4  R4R4 R4R4     R8R8
00760   Complex 128               X8         R8R8  R8R8  R8R8 R8R8     R8R8
00761   Character (unsigned byte) C1         C1    C1    C1   C1       C1
00762   Byte (unsigned byte)      B1         C1    C1    C1   C1       C1
00763 
00764 Machine Numeric Formats:
00765 ***IEEE_BIG (SGI-Iris Assembly Language Programmer's Guide, pages 1-2, 6-3)
00766 I4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
00767          MSB---------------------LSB
00768 R4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
00769     Bits: sign-bit, 8-bit exponent, 23-bit mantissa
00770     The sign of the exponent is:  1=positive, 0=negative (NOT 2's complement)
00771     The interpreation of the floating-point number is:
00772         >>> 2.mantissia(fraction) X 2^exponent. <<<
00773 
00774 R8:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte 3  Byte 4  Byte5   Byte6   Byte7
00775     Bits: sign-bit, 11-bit exponent, 52-bit mantissa
00776 
00777 Machine Numeric Formats:
00778 ***IEEE_LITTLE ( The backwards Big Endian )
00779 I4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
00780          LSB---------------------MSB
00781 R4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
00782     Bits: 23-bit mantissa, 8-bit exponent, sign-bit
00783     The sign of the exponent is:  1=positive, 0=negative (NOT 2's complement)
00784     The interpreation of the floating-point number is:
00785         >>> 2.mantissia(fraction) X 2^exponent. <<<
00786 
00787 R8:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte 3  Byte 4  Byte5   Byte6   Byte7
00788     Bits:  52-bit mantissa, 11-bit exponent, sign-bit
00789 
00790 Note: To convert between these two formats the order of the bytes is reversed
00791 since by definition the Big endian starts at the LSB and goes to the MSB where
00792 the little goes form the MSB to the LSB of the word.
00793 ***
00794 
00795    Possible errors:
00796 NO_ERROR
00797 NULL_STRING_POINTER
00798 NULL_POINTER
00799 ***********************************************************************/
00800 void    ADFI_big_endian_32_swap_64(
00801                 const char from_format,
00802                 const char from_os_size,
00803                 const char to_format,
00804                 const char to_os_size,
00805                 const char data_type[2],
00806                 const unsigned long delta_from_bytes,
00807                 const unsigned long delta_to_bytes,
00808                 const unsigned char *from_data,
00809                 unsigned char *to_data,
00810                 int *error_return )
00811 {
00812 
00813 if( (from_data == NULL) || (to_data == NULL) ) {
00814    *error_return = NULL_STRING_POINTER ;
00815    return ;
00816    } /* end if */
00817 
00818 if( (delta_from_bytes == 0) || (delta_to_bytes == 0) ) {
00819    *error_return = NULL_POINTER ;
00820    return ;
00821    } /* end if */
00822 
00823 if( (from_format == 'N') || (to_format == 'N') ) {
00824    *error_return = CANNOT_CONVERT_NATIVE_FORMAT ;
00825    return ;
00826    } /* end if */
00827 
00828 *error_return = NO_ERROR ;
00829 
00830 if ( delta_to_bytes == delta_from_bytes ) {
00831   memcpy( to_data, from_data, delta_from_bytes ) ;
00832   } /* end if */
00833 else if ( delta_from_bytes < delta_to_bytes ) {
00834   switch( EVAL_2_BYTES( data_type[0], data_type[1] ) ) {
00835     case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'I', '8' ):
00836       if( (from_data[0] & 0x80) == 0x80 ) { /* Negative number */
00837          to_data[0] = 0xff ;
00838          to_data[1] = 0xff ;
00839          to_data[2] = 0xff ;
00840          to_data[3] = 0xff ;
00841       } /* end if */
00842       else {
00843          to_data[0] = 0x00 ;
00844          to_data[1] = 0x00 ;
00845          to_data[2] = 0x00 ;
00846          to_data[3] = 0x00 ;
00847       } /* end else */
00848       to_data[4] = from_data[0] ;
00849       to_data[5] = from_data[1] ;
00850       to_data[6] = from_data[2] ;
00851       to_data[7] = from_data[3] ;
00852       break ;
00853     default:
00854       *error_return = INVALID_DATA_TYPE ;
00855       return ;
00856     } /* end switch */
00857   } /* end else if */
00858 else {
00859   switch( EVAL_2_BYTES( data_type[0], data_type[1] ) ) {
00860     case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'I', '8' ):
00861       to_data[0] = from_data[4] ;
00862       to_data[1] = from_data[5] ;
00863       to_data[2] = from_data[6] ;
00864       to_data[3] = from_data[7] ;
00865       break ;
00866     default:
00867       *error_return = INVALID_DATA_TYPE ;
00868       return ;
00869     } /* end switch */
00870   } /* end else */
00871 
00872 } /* end of ADFI_big_endian_32_swap_64 */
00873 /* end of file ADFI_big_endian_32_swap_64.c */
00874 /* file ADFI_big_endian_to_cray.c */
00875 /***********************************************************************
00876 ADFI big endian to cray:
00877 
00878 input:  const char from_format          Format to convert from. 'B','L','C','N'
00879 input:  const char from_os_size         Format to convert from. 'B','L'
00880 input:  const char to_format            Format to convert to.
00881 input:  const char to_os_size           Format to convert to. 'B','L'
00882 input:  const char data_type[2]         The type of data to convert.
00883                                            MT I4 I8 U4 U8 R4 R8 X4 X8 C1 B1
00884 input:  const unsigned long delta_from_bytes Number of from_bytes used.
00885 input:  const unsigned long delta_to_bytes      Number of to_bytes used.
00886 input:  const char *from_data           The data to convert from.
00887 output: char *to_data                   The resulting data.
00888 output: int *error_return               Error return.
00889 
00890   Recognized data types:
00891                                         Machine representations
00892         Type              Notation     IEEE_BIG   IEEE_LITTLE   Cray
00893                                        32    64   32    64
00894   No data                   MT
00895   Integer 32                I4         I4    I4    I4   I4       I8
00896   Integer 64                I8         --    I8    --   I8       I8
00897   Unsigned 32               U4         I4    I4    I4   I4       I8
00898   Unsigned 64               U8         --    I8    --   I8       I8
00899   Real 32                   R4         R4    R4    R4   R4       R8
00900   Real 64                   R8         R8    R8    R8   R8       R8
00901   Complex 64                X4         R4R4  R4R4  R4R4 R4R4     R8R8
00902   Complex 128               X8         R8R8  R8R8  R8R8 R8R8     R8R8
00903   Character (unsigned byte) C1         C1    C1    C1   C1       C1
00904   Byte (unsigned byte)      B1         C1    C1    C1   C1       C1
00905 
00906 Machine Numeric Formats:
00907 ***IEEE_BIG (SGI-Iris Assembly Language Programmer's Guide, pages 1-2, 6-3)
00908 I4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
00909          MSB---------------------LSB
00910 R4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
00911     Bits: sign-bit, 8-bit exponent, 23-bit mantissa
00912     The sign of the exponent is:  1=positive, 0=negative (NOT 2's complement)
00913     The interpreation of the floating-point number is:
00914         >>> 2.mantissia(fraction) X 2^exponent. <<<
00915 
00916 R8:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte 3  Byte 4  Byte5   Byte6   Byte7
00917     Bits: sign-bit, 11-bit exponent, 52-bit mantissa
00918 
00919 ***Cray (Cray CFT77 Reference Manual, pages G-1 G-2)
00920 I8:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte 3  Byte 4  Byte5   Byte6   Byte7
00921          MSB-----------------------------------------------------LSB
00922 R8:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte 3  Byte 4  Byte5   Byte6   Byte7
00923     Bits: sign-bit, exponent-sign, 14-bit exponent, 48-bit mantissa
00924 Note: Exponent sign:  1 in this bits indicates a positive exponent sign,
00925    thus bit 62 is the inverse of bit 61 (the sign in the exponent).
00926    The exception to this is a zero, in which all 64 bits are zero!
00927     The interpreation of the floating-point number is:
00928         >>> .mantissia(fraction) X 2^exponent. <<<
00929    The mantissia is left justified (the leftmost bit is a 1).
00930      This MUST be done!
00931 
00932 ***
00933 
00934    Possible errors:
00935 NO_ERROR
00936 NULL_STRING_POINTER
00937 NULL_POINTER
00938 ***********************************************************************/
00939 void    ADFI_big_endian_to_cray(
00940                 const char from_format,
00941                 const char from_os_size,
00942                 const char to_format,
00943                 const char to_os_size,
00944                 const char data_type[2],
00945                 const unsigned long delta_from_bytes,
00946                 const unsigned long delta_to_bytes,
00947                 const unsigned char *from_data,
00948                 unsigned char *to_data,
00949                 int *error_return )
00950 {
00951 int             i, exp ;
00952 
00953 if( (from_data == NULL) || (to_data == NULL) ) {
00954    *error_return = NULL_STRING_POINTER ;
00955    return ;
00956    } /* end if */
00957 
00958 if( (delta_from_bytes == 0) || (delta_to_bytes == 0) ) {
00959    *error_return = NULL_POINTER ;
00960    return ;
00961    } /* end if */
00962 
00963 if( (from_format == 'N') || (to_format == 'N') ) {
00964    *error_return = CANNOT_CONVERT_NATIVE_FORMAT ;
00965    return ;
00966    } /* end if */
00967 
00968 *error_return = NO_ERROR ;
00969 
00970 switch( EVAL_2_BYTES( data_type[0], data_type[1] ) ) {
00971 
00972    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'M', 'T' ):
00973       *error_return = NO_DATA ;
00974       return ;
00975 
00976    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'C', '1' ):
00977    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'B', '1' ):
00978       to_data[0] = from_data[0] ;
00979       break ;
00980 
00981    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'I', '4' ):
00982       if( (from_data[0] & 0x80) == 0x80 ) { /* Negative number */
00983          to_data[0] = 0xff ;
00984          to_data[1] = 0xff ;
00985          to_data[2] = 0xff ;
00986          to_data[3] = 0xff ;
00987       } /* end if */
00988       else {
00989          to_data[0] = 0x00 ;
00990          to_data[1] = 0x00 ;
00991          to_data[2] = 0x00 ;
00992          to_data[3] = 0x00 ;
00993       } /* end else */
00994       to_data[4] = from_data[0] ;
00995       to_data[5] = from_data[1] ;
00996       to_data[6] = from_data[2] ;
00997       to_data[7] = from_data[3] ;
00998       break ;
00999 
01000    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'U', '4' ):
01001       to_data[0] = 0x00 ;
01002       to_data[1] = 0x00 ;
01003       to_data[2] = 0x00 ;
01004       to_data[3] = 0x00 ;
01005       to_data[4] = from_data[0] ;
01006       to_data[5] = from_data[1] ;
01007       to_data[6] = from_data[2] ;
01008       to_data[7] = from_data[3] ;
01009       break ;
01010 
01011    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'I', '8' ):
01012       if( (from_data[0] & 0x80) == 0x80 ) { /* Negative number */
01013          to_data[0] = 0xff ;
01014          to_data[1] = 0xff ;
01015          to_data[2] = 0xff ;
01016          to_data[3] = 0xff ;
01017       } /* end if */
01018       else {
01019          to_data[0] = 0x00 ;
01020          to_data[1] = 0x00 ;
01021          to_data[2] = 0x00 ;
01022          to_data[3] = 0x00 ;
01023       } /* end else */
01024       for( i=0; i<(int)delta_from_bytes; i++ )
01025          to_data[8-delta_from_bytes+i] = from_data[i] ;
01026       break ;
01027 
01028    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'U', '8' ):
01029       to_data[0] = 0x00 ;
01030       to_data[1] = 0x00 ;
01031       to_data[2] = 0x00 ;
01032       to_data[3] = 0x00 ;
01033       for( i=0; i<(int)delta_from_bytes; i++ )
01034          to_data[8-delta_from_bytes+i] = from_data[i] ;
01035       break ;
01036 
01037    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'R', '4' ):
01038       for( i=0; i<8; i++ )
01039          to_data[i] = 0x00 ;
01040 
01042       if( (from_data[0] == 0x00) && (from_data[1] == 0x00) &&
01043           (from_data[2] == 0x00) && (from_data[3] == 0x00) )
01044       break ;
01045 
01047       to_data[0] = from_data[0] & 0x80 ;
01048 
01052       exp = (from_data[0] & 0x3f) << 1 ;
01053       if( (from_data[1] & 0x80) == 0x80 )
01054          exp += 1 ;
01055       if( (from_data[0] & 0x40) == 0x00 ) /* set sign */
01056          exp -= 128 ;
01057       exp += 2 ;
01058 
01059       to_data[1] = exp & 0xff ;
01060       if( exp < 0 )
01061          to_data[0] |= 0x3f ; /* exponent sign 0, sign extend exponent */
01062       else
01063          to_data[0] |= 0x40 ; /* exponent sign 1 */
01064 
01067       to_data[2] = from_data[1] | 0x80 ;
01068       to_data[3] = from_data[2] ;
01069       to_data[4] = from_data[3] ;
01070       break ;
01071 
01072    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'R', '8' ):
01073       for( i=0; i<8; i++ )
01074          to_data[i] = 0x00 ;
01075 
01077       if( (from_data[0] == 0x00) && (from_data[1] == 0x00) &&
01078           (from_data[2] == 0x00) && (from_data[3] == 0x00) )
01079       break ;
01080 
01082       to_data[0] = from_data[0] & 0x80 ;
01083 
01087       exp = ((from_data[0] & 0x3f) << 4) + ((from_data[1]>>4)&0x0f) ;
01088 
01089       if( (from_data[0] & 0x40) == 0x00 ) /* set sign */
01090          exp -= 1024 ;
01091       exp += 2 ;
01092 
01093       to_data[1] = (unsigned int)(exp & 0xff) ;
01094       to_data[0] |= ((exp>>8) & 0x03) ;
01095       if( exp < 0 )
01096          to_data[0] |= 0x3c ; /* exponent sign 0, sign extend exponent */
01097       else
01098          to_data[0] |= 0x40 ; /* exponent sign 1 */
01099 
01102       to_data[2] = 0x80 | ((from_data[1]<<3)&0x78) |
01103                           ((from_data[2]>>5)&0x07) ;
01104       for( i=3; i<8; i++ )
01105          to_data[i] = ((from_data[i-1]<<3)&0xF8) |
01106                       ((from_data[i]>>5)&0x07) ;
01107 #ifdef PRINT_STUFF
01108 printf("from:" ) ;
01109 for( i=0; i<8; i++ )
01110    printf("%02x ", from_data[i] ) ;
01111 printf("to:" ) ;
01112 for( i=0; i<8; i++ )
01113    printf("%02x ", to_data[i] ) ;
01114 printf("\n" ) ;
01115 #endif
01116       break ;
01117 
01118    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'X', '4' ):
01119       ADFI_big_endian_to_cray( from_format, from_os_size,
01120          to_format, to_os_size, "R4", delta_from_bytes,
01121          delta_to_bytes, from_data, to_data, error_return ) ;
01122       if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
01123          return ;
01124 
01125       ADFI_big_endian_to_cray( from_format, from_os_size,
01126          to_format, to_os_size, "R4", delta_from_bytes,
01127          delta_to_bytes, &from_data[4], &to_data[8], error_return ) ;
01128       if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
01129          return ;
01130       break ;
01131 
01132    case EVAL_2_BYTES( 'X', '8' ):
01133       ADFI_big_endian_to_cray( from_format, from_os_size,
01134          to_format, to_os_size, "R8", delta_from_bytes,
01135          delta_to_bytes, from_data, to_data, error_return ) ;
01136       if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
01137          return ;
01138 
01139       ADFI_big_endian_to_cray( from_format, from_os_size,
01140          to_format, to_os_size, "R8", delta_from_bytes,
01141          delta_to_bytes, &from_data[8], &to_data[8], error_return ) ;
01142       if( *error_return != NO_ERROR )
01143          return ;
01144       break ;
01145 
01146    default:
01147       *error_return = INVALID_DATA_TYPE ;
01148       return ;
01149    } /* end switch */
01150 } /* end of ADFI_big_endian_to_cray */
01151 /* end of file ADFI_big_endian_to_cray.c */
01152 /* file ADFI_big_little_endian_swap.c */
01153 /***********************************************************************
01154 ADFI big little endian swap:
01155 
01156 input:  const char from_format          Format to convert from. 'B','L','C','N'
01157 input:  const char from_os_size         Format to convert from. 'B','L'
01158 input:  const char to_format            Format to convert to.
01159 input:  const char to_os_size           Format to convert to. 'B','L'
01160 input:  const char data_type[2]         The type of data to convert.
01161                                            MT I4 I8 U4 U8 R4 R8 X4 X8 C1 B1
01162 input:  const unsigned long delta_from_bytes Number of from_bytes used.
01163 input:  const unsigned long delta_to_bytes      Number of to_bytes used.
01164 input:  const char *from_data           The data to convert from.
01165 output: char *to_data                   The resulting data.
01166 output: int *error_return               Error return.
01167 
01168   Recognized data types:
01169                                         Machine representations
01170         Type              Notation     IEEE_BIG   IEEE_LITTLE   Cray
01171                                        32    64   32    64
01172   No data                   MT
01173   Integer 32                I4         I4    I4    I4   I4       I8
01174   Integer 64                I8         --    I8    --   I8       I8
01175   Unsigned 32               U4         I4    I4    I4   I4       I8
01176   Unsigned 64               U8         --    I8    --   I8       I8
01177   Real 32                   R4         R4    R4    R4   R4       R8
01178   Real 64                   R8         R8    R8    R8   R8       R8
01179   Complex 64                X4         R4R4  R4R4  R4R4 R4R4     R8R8
01180   Complex 128               X8         R8R8  R8R8  R8R8 R8R8     R8R8
01181   Character (unsigned byte) C1         C1    C1    C1   C1       C1
01182   Byte (unsigned byte)      B1         C1    C1    C1   C1       C1
01183 
01184 Machine Numeric Formats:
01185 ***IEEE_BIG (SGI-Iris Assembly Language Programmer's Guide, pages 1-2, 6-3)
01186 I4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
01187          MSB---------------------LSB
01188 R4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
01189     Bits: sign-bit, 8-bit exponent, 23-bit mantissa
01190     The sign of the exponent is:  1=positive, 0=negative (NOT 2's complement)
01191     The interpreation of the floating-point number is:
01192         >>> 2.mantissia(fraction) X 2^exponent. <<<
01193 
01194 R8:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte 3  Byte 4  Byte5   Byte6   Byte7
01195     Bits: sign-bit, 11-bit exponent, 52-bit mantissa
01196 
01197 Machine Numeric Formats:
01198 ***IEEE_LITTLE ( The backwards Big Endian )
01199 I4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
01200          LSB---------------------MSB
01201 R4:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte3
01202     Bits: 23-bit mantissa, 8-bit exponent, sign-bit
01203     The sign of the exponent is:  1=positive, 0=negative (NOT 2's complement)
01204     The interpreation of the floating-point number is:
01205         >>> 2.mantissia(fraction) X 2^exponent. <<<
01206 
01207 R8:     Byte0   Byte1   Byte2   Byte 3  Byte 4  Byte5   Byte6   Byte7
01208     Bits:  52-bit mantissa, 11-bit exponent, sign-bit
01209 
01210 Note: To convert between these two formats the order of the bytes is reversed
01211 since by definition the Big endian starts at the LSB and goes to the MSB where
01212 the little goes form the MSB to the LSB of the word.
01213 ***
01214 
01215    Possible errors:
01216 NO_ERROR
01217 NULL_STRING_POINTER
01218 NULL_POINTER
01219 ***********************************************************************/
01220 void    ADFI_big_little_endian_swap(
01221                 const char from_format,
01222                 const char from_os_size,
01223                 const char to_format,
01224                 const char to_os_size,
01225                 const char data_type[2],
01226                 const unsigned long delta_from_bytes,
01227                 const unsigned long delta_to_bytes,
01228                 const unsigned char *from_data,
01229                 unsigned char *to_data,
01230                 int *error_return )
01231 {
01232 int i ;
01233 
01234 if( (from_data == NULL) || (to_data == NULL) ) {
01235    *error_return = NULL_STRING_POINTER ;
01236    return ;
01237    } /* end if */
01238 
01239 if( (delta_from_bytes == 0) || (delta_to_bytes == 0) ) {
01240    *error_return = NULL_POINTER ;
01241    return ;
01242    } /* end if */
01243 
01244 if( (from_format == 'N') || (to_format == 'N') ) {
01245    *error_return = CANNOT_CONVERT_NATIVE_FORMAT ;
01246    return ;
01247    } /* end if */
01248 
01249 if ( from_os_size != to_os_size || delta_to_bytes != delta_from_bytes ) {
01250    *error_return = DATA_TYPE_NOT_SUPPORTED ;
01251    return ;
01252 } 
01254 *error_return = NO_ERROR ;
01255 
01256 for ( i=0; i<(int)delta_from_bytes; i++ )
01257   to_data[i] = from_data[delta_from_bytes-1-i] ;
01258 
01259 } /* end of ADFI_big_little_endian_swap */
01260 /* end of file ADFI_big_little_endian_swap.c */
01261 /* file ADFI_blank_fill_string.c */
01262 /***********************************************************************
01263 ADFI blank fill string:
01264 
01265 input/output: char *str         The string to fill with blanks.
01266 input:  const int length        The total length of the string to fill.
01267 ***********************************************************************/
01268 void ADFI_blank_fill_string(
01269                 char *str,
01270                 const int length )
01271 {
01272 int     i ;
01273 for( i=strlen( str ); i<length; i++ )
01274    str[ i ] = ' ' ;
01275 }
